Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the invertebrate defensin family (Type 1 subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Bifidobacterium adolescentis ATCC15703, Bifidobacterium longum ATCC15707, Leuconostoc cremoris ATCC 19254, Lactobacillus spps, Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus spps
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Found in royal jelly and in hemolymph, potent antibacterial protein against Gram-positive bacteria at low concentration.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: High expression in head, hypopharyngeal gland, and mandibular gland. Low expression in thorax and thoracic salivary gland.
Sequence Information.PTM: Contains three disulfide bonds 3-31; 17-36; 21-38 and Phenylalanine amide at F51.

Literature.Title: A potent antibacterial protein in royal jelly. Purification and determination of the primary structure of royalisin.
Literature.Author: Fujiwara S, Imai J, Fujiwara M, Yaeshima T, Kawashima T, Kobayashi K.

Literature.Title: Acute transcriptional response of the honeybee peptide-antibiotics gene repertoire and required post-translational conversion of the precursor structures.

Literature.Title: Rapid evolution of immune proteins in social insects.
